intro: Carum turkestanicum, commonly known as Turkestan caraway, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to caraway. The plant's essential oils contribute to its distinctive scent and medicinal properties.
